metadata.title: CVE-2015-7673 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
io-tga.c in gdk-pixbuf before 2.32.0 uses heap memory after its allocationfailed, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) and possibly executearbitrary code via a crafted Truevision TGA (TARGA) file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7673` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gdkpixbuf-2.0 - 2.30.7-0ubuntu1.2
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0 - 2.30.7-0ubuntu1.2
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-common - 2.30.7-0ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdk-pixbuf package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30.7-0ubuntu1.2').
